main event: A young boy of about eight years old in Quincy, Massachusetts sighted a reddish-orange disk-shaped object hovering in the air with no apparent means of propulsion at 2330 hours on 16 March 1962.
interesting points: The object appeared to be about the size of a small weather balloon.
The object remained stationary in the air for approximately two minutes before moving off at great speed, straight up into the night sky.
The report was forwarded to the Department of the Air Force for further evaluation and disposition.
The Department of the Air Force was unable to definitively identify the object observed.
The Department of the Air Force requested to be advised of any subsequent information developed concerning this incident.
witnesses: a young boy of about eight years old
